preamble.longtitle: An Act to [a.d. 1988.] provide for the construction of a bridge over the river Thames between Dartford in Kent and Thurrock in Essex and of associated works; to provide for the Secretary of State to be the highway authority for the highways passing through the tunnels under that river between Dartford and Thurrock and their approaches instead of Kent and Essex County Councils; to provide for the levying of tolls, by a person appointed by the Secretary of State or by the Secretary of State, in respect of traffic using the crossing; to provide for transfers of property and liabilities of those Councils to the person appointed and the Secretary of State and for the transfer to the Secretary of State of property and liabilities of the person appointed on termination of his appointment; to provide for the management of the crossing, including the imposition of prohibitions, restrictions and requirements in relation to traffic, and otherwise in relation to the crossing; and for connected purposes.
preamble.enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

content.leaf: Construction of New Bridge over River Thames

Construction of the scheduled works.The Secretary of State may, subject to and in accordance with the provisions of this Act, construct the works specified in Part I of Schedule 1 to this Act (below in this Act referred to as the scheduled works), being works for the construction of a new bridge over the river Thames between the borough of Dartford, in the county of Kent, and the borough of Thurrock, in the county of Essex, and certain associated works.
Construction of the scheduled works.References below in this Act to the bridge are references to the bridge mentioned in subsection (1) above (Work No.3).

Construction of the scheduled works.Subject to Part II of that Schedule (which gives the limits of deviation for the scheduled works, permits deviation from the levels shown on the deposited sections and specifies requirements as to the construction of the bridge) the scheduled works shall be constructed in the lines or situations shown on the deposited plans and in accordance with the levels shown on the deposited sections.

leaf.margin: Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.

content.leaf: Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.The Secretary of State is authorised by this section to acquire compulsorily—

Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.so much of the land shown on the deposited plans within the limits of deviation for the scheduled works as may be required for or in connection with those works; and

Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.so much of any land specified in columns 1 and 2 of Part I of Schedule 2 to this Act shown on the deposited plans within the limits of land to be acquired as may be required for the purpose specified in relation to the land in column 3 as one for which this Act authorises it to be acquired or used.

Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.Part I of the [1965 c. 56.] Compulsory Purchase Act 1965 (except sections 4 and 27 and paragraph 3(3) of Schedule 3), in so far as it is applicable for the purposes of this Act and is not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, shall apply to the acquisition of land under this section as it applies to a compulsory purchase to which Schedule 1 to the [1981 c. 67.] Acquisition of Land Act 1981 applies and as if this Act were a compulsory purchase order under that Act.

Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.A notice to treat under Part I of the Compulsory Purchase Act 1965 for the purpose of acquiring any land under this section shall not be served after 31st December 1992.
Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.The [1845 c. 18.] Lands Clauses Consolidation Act 1845 shall not apply to the acquisition of land under this section.

Acquisition of land for the scheduled works and other authorised works.Part II of Schedule 2 to this Act shall have effect for making supplementary provision relating to the acquisition of land for or in connection with the works authorised by this Act.

Supplementary provision as to authorised works.Schedule 3 to this Act shall have effect for making provision for the purpose of or in connection with the construction of the works authorised by this Act and for making in connection with those works provision with respect to highways and road traffic regulation.
Transfer of Tunnels and Tunnel Approaches
Status of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches, etc.

leaf.margin: Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.

content.leaf: Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.On such date as the Secretary of State may by order appoint the tunnel highway and such parts of the tunnel approaches as immediately before that date are not trunk roads shall become trunk roads as if they had become so by virtue of an order under section 10(2) of the [1980 c. 66.] Highways Act 1980 specifying that date as the date on which they were to become trunk roads.
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.The date appointed under subsection (1) above is referred to below in this Act as the transfer date.
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.In this Act—

Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches."the tunnel highway" means the highway over such parts of the A282 as pass through the tunnels or lie within land shown on the deposited plans as forming part of the tunnel crossing, and includes the tunnels themselves;
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches."the tunnel approaches" means the highways over the approach roads;

Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches."the tunnels" means the tunnel authorised by the enactments repealed by the [1967 c. xxxvii.] Dartford Tunnel Act 1967 and the tunnel authorised by that Act;

Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches."the approach roads" means such parts of the A282 (other than those passing through the tunnels) as lie outside land shown on the deposited plans as forming part of the tunnel crossing, together with any slip roads joining them; and
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches."the tunnel crossing" means—
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.the tunnel highway; and
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.any land not forming part of that highway which is shown on the deposited plans as forming part of the tunnel crossing.
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.The [1984 c. xvii.] Dartford Tunnel Act 1984 shall cease to have effect on the transfer date.
Trunking of tunnel highway and tunnel approaches.The Highways Act 1980 and the Dartford Tunnel Act 1984 are below in this Act referred to respectively as the 1980 Act and the 1984 Act.

leaf.margin: Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.

content.leaf: Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.As from the transfer date any road within the tunnel crossing which was a highway immediately before that date, other than the tunnel highway, shall cease to be a highway.

Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.As from that date, the [1984 c. 27.] Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 shall have effect in relation to any road within the tunnel crossing which is not a highway as if it were a trunk road.

Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.The Secretary of State may by order make provision for applying any specified enactment relating to highways in relation to any specified part of any road or other land within the tunnel crossing which is not a highway as if that part were a highway, or a highway of any specified description, for which he is the highway authority.
Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.Any such order may provide for modifying any enactment as it applies by virtue of the order.
Status of roads, etc., other than the tunnel highway.In this section "specified" means specified by the order.
Transfers consequential on section 4

leaf.margin: Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.

content.leaf: Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.Section 265 of the 1980 Act (transfer of property and liabilities to Secretary of State upon a highway becoming a trunk road) shall not apply by virtue of section 4 of this Act; but, subject to the following provisions of this section and to section 7 of this Act, on the transfer date there are transferred to the Secretary of State by virtue of this section—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.the tunnel crossing;
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.such parts of the tunnel approaches as immediately before that date are not trunk roads;

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.the property mentioned in subsection (2) below, in so far as, immediately before that date, it was vested in either of the Councils (or in them jointly) for the purposes of any of their functions in relation to the tunnel crossing or the tunnel approaches; and

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.all liabilities incurred by either of the Councils (or by them jointly) for the purposes of any of those functions and not discharged before that date, other than loans and loan charges;
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.and the property so transferred vests, by virtue of this section, in the Secretary of State.
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.The property referred to in subsection (1)(c) above is—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.any easement or right in or over land; and

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.all other property (including the unexpended balances of any grants paid by the Secretary of State to the Councils or either of them for the purposes of any of their functions in relation to the tunnel crossing or the tunnel approaches), other than—

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.materials to be used for the maintenance or improvement of the tunnel highway or the tunnel approaches or of any works on land within the tunnel crossing;

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.the unexpended balances of any loans raised by either of the Councils (or by them jointly) for the purposes of any of those functions; and
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.tolls collected in pursuance of the 1984 Act.
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.Subject to subsection (4) below, there is not transferred to the Secretary of State by virtue of this section—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.any right or liability in respect of—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.work done, services rendered, goods delivered, or money due for payment, before the transfer date; or
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.damages or compensation for any act or omission before that date; or
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.any right or liability under any contract of insurance.
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.Any such right or liability as is mentioned in subsection (3)(a) above is so transferred if—

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.it was not acquired or incurred solely for the purposes of any of the functions of the Councils in relation to the tunnel approaches; and

Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.any payment received or made in respect of it would have fallen to be taken into account in determining the amount of any expenditure of the Councils which, but for the repeal by this Act of the 1984 Act, would have fallen to be met from county funds of the Councils by virtue of section 30(3) of that Act (application of sum equivalent to the amount of the tolls collected under that Act).
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.In this Act—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.references to the functions of the Councils in relation to the tunnel crossing or the tunnel approaches are references to—
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.all their functions under the 1984 Act; and
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State.any other functions of theirs in relation to that crossing or those approaches; and
Transfer of tunnel crossing and tunnel approaches to Secretary of State."the Councils" means the Essex County Council and the Kent County Council.

leaf.margin: Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.

content.leaf: Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.This section applies where before the transfer date a person is appointed to levy tolls under section 11 of this Act and his appointment is still effective on that date.

Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.On that date, such of the property and liabilities mentioned in subsection (3) below as would apart from this section fall to be transferred by virtue of section 6 of this Act to the Secretary of State are instead transferred by virtue of this section to the person appointed; and the property so transferred vests in that person by virtue of this section.
Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.The property and liabilities referred to in subsection (2) above are—

Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.all movable property which, immediately before the transfer date, was property which was normally kept anywhere within the tunnel crossing;
Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.any right or liability relating to any such movable property;

Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.any right or liability in respect of the price of, or compensation for, any land within the tunnel crossing purchased, or for which a contract to purchase has been concluded, before the transfer date;

Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.any right or liability under a contract entered into by the Councils under section 26 of the 1984 Act (power to compound for payment of tolls); and
Transfer of toll undertaking to person appointed under section 11.any such right or liability as is mentioned in section 6(3)(a) of this Act.

leaf.margin: Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.

content.leaf: Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.Schedule 4 to this Act shall have effect in relation to a transfer by virtue of section 6 or 7 of this Act, and for the purpose of providing for further transfers and for supplementary and transitional matters in connection with the operation of those sections.

Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.Parts I and III of Schedule 5 to this Act shall have effect with respect to the transfer to employment with a new employer, in consequence of the operation of section 6 or 7 of this Act, of persons—

Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.who immediately before the transfer date were employed by Kent County Council for the purposes of or in connection with the exercise by the Councils of any of their functions in relation to the tunnel crossing or the tunnel approaches; and
Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.whose normal place of employment immediately before the transfer date was within the tunnel crossing;
Supplementary provisions and transfers of staff.and references in Part I of that Schedule to relevant employees of Kent County Council are references to persons within this subsection.
Financial provisions

leaf.margin: Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.

content.leaf: Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.The liabilities of the Councils as at the transfer date in respect of the principal of, and interest on, sums borrowed from the Secretary of State in respect of tunnel expenditure shall be extinguished.

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.The Secretary of State shall, in accordance with the provisions of this section, pay to each of the Councils the amount required to discharge their respective liabilities as at the transfer date in respect of the principal of, and interest on, sums borrowed otherwise than from the Secretary of State in respect of tunnel expenditure less their respective unapplied tolls amounts.
Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.In this section—

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc."tunnel expenditure" means expenditure incurred for or in respect of the tunnel undertaking (within the meaning of the 1984 Act) or for paying interest on sums borrowed for the purposes of defraying such expenditure; and

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc."the unapplied tolls amount", in relation to either of the Councils, means the amount which immediately before the transfer date remains to be applied by the Council in accordance with section 30(3) of the 1984 Act.

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.Not less than fourteen days before the transfer date the Secretary of State shall give notice of that date to the Councils and not less than seven days before that date they shall jointly furnish to him a copy of accounts (the provisional accounts) in such form as he may approve relating to the collection of tolls and the application of money under section 30 of the 1984 Act from the end of the period covered by the last accounts of which a copy was furnished to him under that section to the transfer date; and the provisional accounts may, to the extent necessary, take the form of estimates.
Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.The provisional accounts shall also include estimates of—
Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.the amount falling to be extinguished by virtue of subsection (1) above;

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.the amount required to discharge the respective liabilities of the Councils as at the transfer date in respect of the principal of, and interest on, sums borrowed otherwise than from the Secretary of State in respect of tunnel expenditure (including details of how that amount relates to the actual amount of those liabilities as at that date); and
Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.the Councils' respective unapplied tolls amounts.

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.Before the end of the period of ninety days beginning with the transfer date the Councils shall jointly furnish to the Secretary of State a copy of accounts (the final accounts) in such form as he may approve relating to the matters mentioned in subsection (4) above (but not including anything in the form of estimates) and including a final statement of the amounts mentioned in subsection (5)(a) to (c) above.

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.On the transfer date the Secretary of State shall make a payment to each of the Councils in pursuance of subsection (2) above in accordance with the provisional accounts.

Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.If the final accounts show that there fall to be paid in pursuance of subsection (2) above amounts greater in the aggregate than the aggregate of the payments under subsection (7) above, the Secretary of State shall, within fourteen days of the furnishing to him of the copy of those accounts, pay one-half of the amount of the difference to each of the Councils; and if the converse case occurs each of the Councils shall pay one-half of the amount of the difference to the Secretary of State within that period.
Termination of borrowings for tunnels, etc.Any dispute as to an amount falling to be paid under this section shall be determined by arbitration.

Payment of transfer expenses.If either or both of the Councils make to the Secretary of State within twenty-eight days of the transfer date a claim in respect of expenses to which this subsection applies, he shall within twenty-eight days of the date on which he receives the claim make them a payment equal to the amount of those expenses.
Payment of transfer expenses.Subsection (1) above applies to expenses—

Payment of transfer expenses.which are incurred on or after 1st January 1986 in connection with the transfer of any property or liability from them under or by virtue of this Act or in providing assistance in the preparation of this Part of the Bill for this Act; and
Payment of transfer expenses.which are not such as were, or before the transfer date could have been, met from county funds under section 30(3) of the 1984 Act.

Payment of transfer expenses.Where a claim is made under this section, the Secretary of State may require the production to him of such documents and the furnishing to him of such other information as he considers relevant with respect to the claim and he shall not be required to make any payment in response to the claim until such documents are produced, or other information furnished, to him.

Payment of transfer expenses.Any dispute as to an amount falling to be paid under this section shall be determined by arbitration, but where the dispute is as to some only of the expenses to which a claim relates nothing in this subsection shall affect any duty of the Secretary of State to make a payment under this section in respect of any other expenses to which it also relates.
Operation of the Crossing
Power to levy tolls and management and maintenance, etc., of the crossing and the approach roads

leaf.margin: Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.

content.leaf: Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.Subject to and in accordance with the following provisions of this Part of this Act, tolls may be levied in respect of vehicles using either of the tunnels or the bridge.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.Below in this Act "toll" means a toll leviable under this Part of this Act.

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.Tolls may be levied by a person appointed by the Secretary of State, if the requirements of subsection (4) below are met in relation to that person's appointment.

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.The appointment must be made under a contract between the Secretary of State and the person appointed providing for the construction by that person of the bridge (whether or not together with any other of the scheduled works) and the maintenance by that person—
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.as from such date as may be provided by or under the contract, of the tunnels and such other parts of the crossing as may be specified in the contract; and
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.as from such later date as may be so provided, of the whole of the crossing;

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.and that contract must not have been preceded by any contract between the Secretary of State and any other person providing for the construction of the bridge.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.The appointment shall be subject to such terms and conditions as may be agreed in the contract.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.Where the contract comes to an end otherwise than—

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.on exercise by the person appointed of any right of his to terminate the contract in consequence of any breach by the Secretary of State of his obligations under the contract; or

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.at the end of the period allowed under section 16 of this Act for the levy of tolls by the person appointed in default of earlier termination of his appointment;
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.tolls may be levied by the Secretary of State.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.Tolls shall be leviable by the person appointed under this section—
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.as from the transfer date, as respects vehicles using either of the tunnels; and
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.as from the date on which the bridge is first open for public use, as respects vehicles using the bridge;
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.until the end of the period so allowed or the termination of his appointment, whichever first occurs.

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.If subsection (6) above applies, tolls shall be leviable by the Secretary of State as respects vehicles using either of the tunnels or the bridge as from the time when the contract comes to an end or, where it comes to an end before the date applicable in the case of the vehicles in question in accordance with subsection (7)(a) or (b) above, as from that date.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.In this Act "the crossing" means—
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.the tunnel crossing;
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.the bridge (including the highway carried by it); and

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.any land which may be acquired by the Secretary of State in exercise of any of his powers under Part XII of the 1980 Act in relation to any trunk road or other land forming part of the crossing by virtue of paragraph (a) or (b) above;

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.but as respects any time before the bridge is open for public use references below in this Act to the crossing shall be read as referring only to the tunnel crossing and such other parts of the crossing as the context may require.
Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.References in this Act to the toll period are references—

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.to the period allowed under section 16 of this Act for the levy of tolls by the person appointed under this section in default of earlier termination of his appointment; or

Power to levy tolls for use of the crossing.if subsection (6) above applies, to the period beginning with the transfer date and ending at the end of the period allowed under that section for the levy of tolls by the Secretary of State.

leaf.margin: Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.

content.leaf: Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.Subject to the following provisions of this section, the Secretary of State may by agreement with any person delegate to that person all or any of his functions with respect to the maintenance and improvement of, or other dealing with, any trunk road or other land comprised in the crossing.
Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.A delegation under subsection (1) above may only be made—

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.if tolls are for the time being leviable by the person appointed under section 11 of this Act, to that person; or

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.if tolls are for the time being leviable by the Secretary of State and he appoints any person to collect the tolls as his agent, to that person.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.Without prejudice to the application of subsection (1) above and section 6(1) of the 1980 Act (delegation by Secretary of State of trunk road functions to local councils) in relation to functions of the Secretary of State under this Act, each of those provisions shall apply in relation to—

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.any functions conferred by or under this Part of this Act on the crossing operator which are for the time being exercisable by the Secretary of State; and

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.the power of the Secretary of State under section 23 of this Act to withdraw or suspend the restriction imposed by subsection (1) of that section;
Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.as it applies in relation to functions of his of a description mentioned in subsection (1) above.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.In this Act "the crossing operator" means the person appointed under section 11 of this Act to levy tolls, in relation to any time when tolls are for the time being leviable by that person, and otherwise means the Secretary of State.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.No functions may be delegated under subsection (1) above to any council to whom the Secretary of State may under section 6(1) of the 1980 Act (including that provision as extended by subsection (3) above) delegate any of his functions.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.Any person to whom any functions are delegated under this section shall, in the exercise of those functions, act as agent for the Secretary of State and in accordance with such conditions as he may attach to the delegation.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.Any agreement made by the Secretary of State for delegating any of his functions under this section shall not prevent him from exercising any function delegated if he considers that it is necessary or expedient for him to do so—
Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.by reason of any emergency; or

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.on the ground that, in his view, the delegate has failed or will be unable to carry out any works, or do any other thing, that appears to the Secretary of State to be necessary for the discharge of that function.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.A delegation of any functions under this section may be terminated in such circumstances and in such manner as may be provided under the agreement providing for the delegation.

Delegation of functions of Secretary of State in relation to the crossing and the approach roads.Nothing in this section limits the power of the Secretary of State to enter into and carry into effect agreements with any person for any purpose connected with the exercise of any function he has power to delegate under subsection (1) above.

leaf.margin: Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.

content.leaf: Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.The Secretary of State shall have power to grant to the person appointed under section 11 of this Act a lease—
Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.of any land comprised in the crossing; and

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.of any easement or right in or over land not so comprised, being an easement or right acquired by him under section 2 of this Act or transferred to him under section 6 of this Act;

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.if it appears to him to be expedient to do so for the purpose of or in connection with the exercise by that person of any of the functions mentioned in subsection (2) below.
Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.Those functions are—
Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.any functions of the person appointed under the contract under which he was appointed;

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.any functions conferred or imposed by or under this Part of this Act on the crossing operator which are for the time being exercisable by the person appointed; and
Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.any functions of the Secretary of State delegated to him under section 12 of this Act.

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.No enactment or rule of law regulating the rights and obligations of landlords and tenants shall prejudice the operation of any agreement between the Secretary of State and the person appointed so far as relates to the terms on which any land which is the subject of a lease granted in pursuance of this section is to be provided for that person's use; and accordingly no such enactment or rule of law shall apply in relation to the rights and obligations of the parties to any lease so granted—

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.so as to exclude or in any respect modify any of the rights and obligations of those parties under the terms of the lease, whether with respect to the termination of the tenancy or any other matter;

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.so as to confer or impose on either party any right or obligation arising out of or connected with anything done or omitted on or in relation to land which is the subject of the lease, in addition to any such right or obligation provided for by the terms of the lease; or

Leases of crossing land, etc.: application of landlord and tenant law.so as to restrict the enforcement (whether by action for damages or otherwise) by either party to the lease of any obligation of the other party under the lease.

leaf.margin: Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.

content.leaf: Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.This section applies where the appointment of the person appointed under section 11 of this Act to levy tolls comes to an end after the transfer date.

Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.Subject to the following provisions of this section and section 15 of this Act, on the termination of the appointment there are transferred to the Secretary of State by virtue of this section—
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.all movable property belonging to the person appointed immediately before termination—
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.which was transferred to that person under section 7 of this Act; or
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.which, immediately before termination, was property which was normally kept anywhere within the crossing;

Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.all assets of the person appointed of a description within subsection (3) below which fall in accordance with the contract under which he was appointed to be transferred to the Secretary of State on termination of the appointment in the circumstances in which it has in fact terminated; and
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.all rights and liabilities of the person appointed subsisting immediately before termination which—
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.were acquired or incurred by that person for the purposes of or in connection with the exercise of any relevant functions; or
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.arose from that person's occupation of the crossing;
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.and the property so transferred vests, by virtue of this section, in the Secretary of State.
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.The assets referred to in subsection (2)(b) above are—
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.assets representing revenue produced by the tolls and other revenue of the person appointed; and

Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.the unexpended balances of any loan funds raised by the person appointed for the purposes of or in connection with the exercise of any relevant functions.
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.In paragraph (b) above "loan funds" means funds raised by borrowing or by the issue of loan stock.
Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.Subsection (2)(c) above does not apply in relation to rights and liabilities in respect of loans, loan stock and loan charges.

Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.Where the appointment terminates at the end of the period allowed under section 16 of this Act for the levy of tolls by the person appointed, any right or liability of that person under any contract (not being a contract of employment) entered into by him for or in connection with the collection of tolls is not transferred by virtue of this section unless it is acquired or incurred in respect of things done or omitted before termination.

Termination of appointment under section 11 after the transfer date.Parts II and III of Schedule 5 to this Act shall have effect for making in connection with the operation of this section provision relating to employees and former employees of the person appointed.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Any property vested in the Secretary of State by virtue of section 14 of this Act on termination of the appointment of the person appointed under section 11 of this Act to levy tolls shall vest free from any security to which it was subject immediately before termination.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Where before termination possession of any such property has been taken by any person in pursuance of any legal process or distress, the Secretary of State shall be entitled to recover that property from any person in possession of it without being required, as a condition of doing so, to meet any liability in respect of which that process or distress was issued or levied.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Subsection (1) above is without prejudice to any liability secured by any security from which any such property is released by virtue of that subsection, and subsection (2) above is without prejudice to any liability in respect of which the process or distress there mentioned was issued or levied.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Where any liability which, if it had subsisted immediately before termination, would have fallen to be transferred to the Secretary of State by virtue of section 14 of this Act has been discharged before termination, nothing in the [1986 c. 45.] Insolvency Act 1986 shall—
Termination: supplementary provisions.affect the validity of anything done by the person appointed or by any other person in discharging that liability;

Termination: supplementary provisions.authorise a court to make any order affecting the property of, or imposing any obligation on, any person in consequence of or in connection with the receipt by that person or by any other person of any payment made, property transferred or other benefit provided by the person appointed or by any other person in discharging that liability; or
Termination: supplementary provisions.be treated as giving rise to any trust affecting any money or property so transferred.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Subject to subsection (1) above, any property vested in the Secretary of State by virtue of section 14 of this Act shall be held by him subject to all covenants, conditions and restrictions subject to which the property was held by the person appointed.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Any dispute between the Secretary of State and any person as to the property or liabilities transferred by virtue of section 14 of this Act shall be determined by arbitration; and, where any such dispute is one between the Secretary of State and the person appointed, the arbitration shall be subject to the provisions relating to arbitration of the contract under which that person was appointed.

Termination: supplementary provisions.Subject to subsection (1) above, all agreements or other transactions entered into or effected by the person appointed and subsisting immediately before termination, in so far as they relate to property or liabilities transferred by virtue of section 14 of this Act to the Secretary of State, shall have effect with the substitution of the Secretary of State for the person appointed; and accordingly—
Termination: supplementary provisions.any such agreement or transaction may be enforced by or against the Secretary of State; and
Termination: supplementary provisions.references to the person appointed—
Termination: supplementary provisions.in any agreement (whether or not in writing) and in any deed, bond or instrument, so far as relating to any such property or liabilities; and
Termination: supplementary provisions.in any other document whatsoever relating to or affecting any such property or liabilities;
Termination: supplementary provisions.shall be taken after termination as referring to the Secretary of State.

Termination: supplementary provisions.All proceedings, legal or other, begun before termination and relating to any such property or liabilities, other than proceedings for enforcing any security from which any such property is released by virtue of subsection (1) above, may be carried on with the substitution of the Secretary of State in lieu of the person appointed, and any such proceedings may be amended in such manner as may be necessary for that purpose.
Termination: supplementary provisions.In this section "security" means any mortgage, charge, lien or other security.
Termination: supplementary provisions.References in this Act, in relation to the person appointed, to relevant functions are references to—
Termination: supplementary provisions.any functions of the person appointed under the contract under which he was appointed or under any lease granted under section 13 of this Act;

Termination: supplementary provisions.any functions conferred or imposed by or under this Part of this Act on the crossing operator which are for the time being exercisable by the person appointed; and
Termination: supplementary provisions.any functions of the Secretary of State delegated to him under section 12 of this Act.

leaf.margin: Time limit for levy of tolls.

content.leaf: Time limit for levy of tolls.Tolls shall cease to be leviable at the end of the period allowed under subsection (2) below or, where section 11(6) of this Act applies, at the end of the period allowed under subsection (3) below.

Time limit for levy of tolls.The period allowed for the levy of tolls by the person appointed under section 11 of this Act, in default of earlier termination of his appointment, is the period determined in accordance with Part I of Schedule 6 to this Act.
Time limit for levy of tolls.The period allowed for the levy of tolls by the Secretary of State is the period determined in accordance with Part II of that Schedule.

Time limit for levy of tolls.Where the period allowed for the levy of tolls by the person appointed under section 11 of this Act includes any toll extension period under paragraph 4 of that Schedule, references in section 14 of this Act to relevant functions shall include references to any functions of the person appointed under the contract relating to the levy of tolls by that person during the toll extension period.
Tolls and their administration

leaf.margin: Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.

content.leaf: Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.The classes of vehicles in respect of which tolls may be levied shall be those established immediately before the transfer date by any classification of vehicles then in force under the 1984 Act.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Subject to the following provisions of this section, the toll leviable on and after the transfer date in respect of a vehicle of any class shall be that in force immediately before that date in respect of vehicles of that class.
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Below in this section—
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls."the base month" means, subject to subsection (10) below, the month of June; and
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls."the revision date" means the date immediately following the end of the period of two months beginning with the 1st day of the base month.
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Subject to subsection (9) below, on or within the period of seven days next following—
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.the first revision date after the transfer date; and
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.each succeeding revision date falling within the toll period;
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.the Secretary of State shall make an order fixing the amounts of the tolls in respect of all classes of vehicles in respect of which tolls are leviable.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Subject to the following provisions of this section, the amount of the toll to be fixed by the order in respect of each class of vehicles shall be an amount arrived at by increasing the amount applicable in the case of that class on 1st January 1986 by the same percentage as the percentage increase between the retail prices index for December 1985 and the retail prices index for the month which is the base month in relation to the revision date in question.
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Any amount which falls in accordance with subsection (5) above to be fixed by an order under this section—
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.if it is neither a multiple of ten nor an amount which on division by ten produces a remainder of five, shall be rounded to the nearest ten pence; and
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.if it is an amount which on division by ten produces a remainder of five, shall be increased by five pence.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Subject to subsection (8) below, where the amount of any toll which, in accordance with the preceding provisions of this section, falls to be fixed by an order made under this section in respect of any class of vehicles exceeds that in force under the last previous order so made, the new order may fix an amount which does not implement the increase or implements it only in part.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Where tolls are for the time being leviable by the person appointed under section 11 of this Act, an order under this section may not by virtue of subsection (7) above fix an amount for any toll which does not implement, or implements only in part, any increase in the amount of that toll which would otherwise fall to be made under this section, except at the request of that person.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Where, on any occasion when an order fixing the amounts of tolls falls to be made in accordance with subsection (4) above, in the case of the toll leviable in respect of each class of vehicles in respect of which tolls are leviable either—

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.the amount which, in accordance with the preceding provisions of this section, would fall to be fixed by the order does not exceed that in force under the last previous order so made; or

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.any increase which would fall to be made in the amount of that toll is one which by virtue of subsection (7) above need not be implemented by the order and the Secretary of State proposes not to implement it;
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.an order under subsection (4) above need not be made on that occasion.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Where the retail prices index for any month during the toll period which is not for the time being the base month for the purposes of this section shows an increase of twelve per cent. or more over that for the last preceding base month, the month first mentioned above shall become the base month for the purposes of this section.
Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.An order made under this section shall come into force on the 1st day of the month next following that in which it is made.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.References in this section to the retail prices index are references to the general index of retail prices (for all items) published by the Department of Employment; and if that index is not published for any month those references shall be read as references to any substituted index or index figures published by that Department for that month.

Classification of vehicles and level of tolls.Subsection (8) above shall not apply in relation to any order made under this section during any toll extension period under paragraph 4 of Schedule 6 to this Act.
Temporary suspension of tolls.Subject to the following provisions of this section, tolls may be suspended by the crossing operator.
Temporary suspension of tolls.A suspension may relate to all vehicles using the crossing, or only to all such vehicles travelling from north to south, or from south to north.

Temporary suspension of tolls.Where the person appointed under section 11 of this Act to levy tolls is the crossing operator, his power to suspend tolls under this section shall be subject to any conditions in the contract under which he was appointed.
Exemption from tolls.Nothing in this Act shall authorise the levying of tolls in respect of—
Exemption from tolls.a vehicle identifiable by writing or markings on it or otherwise by its appearance as being the property of—
Exemption from tolls.a police authority;
Exemption from tolls.a fire authority as defined in the [1947 c. 41.] Fire Services Act 1947; or
Exemption from tolls.one of the civil defence forces or the civil defence services as respectively defined in the [1948 c. 5. (12, 13 & 14 Geo 6)] Civil Defence Act 1948;
Exemption from tolls.being used in the execution of duty;

Exemption from tolls.an ambulance or other vehicle if it is being used by a health authority (as defined in the [1977 c. 49.] National Health Service Act 1977) or by a voluntary organisation or other person under an arrangement made under that Act;

Exemption from tolls.any other ambulance if it is being used for the purpose of or in connection with the transport of persons requiring or receiving medical treatment or for the carriage in an emergency of medical apparatus or supplies;
Exemption from tolls.a vehicle exempted from duty under section 4(1)(g) of the [1971 c. 10.] Vehicles (Excise) Act 1971 if it is being used for the purposes of an invalid; or
Exemption from tolls.a vehicle so exempted under section 7(2) of that Act if it is being used by or for the purposes of a person suffering from a physical defect or disability.

Composition agreements.The crossing operator may enter into agreements ("composition agreements") under which persons compound in advance, on such terms as may be provided by the agreement, for the payment of tolls in respect of the use of the crossing by them, by other persons or by any vehicles.
Composition agreements.A composition agreement may relate to use on such number of occasions or during such period as may be provided by the agreement.

Composition agreements.Composition agreements offered by the crossing operator to persons seeking to compound in advance for the payment of tolls must be offered on the same terms with respect to the same description of use of the crossing to all persons seeking so to compound in respect of use of that description.

List of tolls to be exhibited.A list of the tolls for the time being leviable shall at all times be exhibited in a conspicuous position within a reasonable distance of any place at which tolls are payable.

Refusal to pay tolls.Any person who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to pay any toll for which he is liable or attempts to evade payment of any such toll shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 3 on the standard scale.

Refusal to pay tolls.The powers mentioned in subsection (3) below are exercisable in relation to any such person (referred to in that subsection as the person in default) by any traffic officer or by any person employed at the crossing for the purpose of the collection of tolls.
Refusal to pay tolls.Those powers are—
Refusal to pay tolls.to refuse to permit the person in default to pass through any place at which tolls are payable;
Refusal to pay tolls.whether by himself or with such assistance as he thinks necessary, to prevent the person in default from passing through any such place; and
Refusal to pay tolls.to require the person in default to leave the crossing by such route as a traffic officer may direct.
Regulation of traffic using crossing or approach roads

leaf.margin: Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.

content.leaf: Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.Subject to subsections (2) and (4) below, so much of the A282 as passes through the tunnels or is carried by the bridge and such other parts of the crossing and such parts of the approach roads as may be prescribed shall not be available for use by any of the following classes of traffic—
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.pedestrians;
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.animals;
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.pedal cycles; and
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.other vehicles which are not mechanically powered (unless drawn by a mechanically powered vehicle).

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.The Secretary of State may at any time by such notice in writing as he thinks appropriate withdraw or suspend (either permanently or temporarily and either as respects particular traffic or as respects traffic of all or any of the classes mentioned in subsection (1) above) the restriction imposed by that subsection.

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.Such a withdrawal or suspension may be made on and subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary of State may determine, including conditions imposing tolls at such of the levels at which tolls are for the time being levied as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.The restriction imposed by subsection (1) above shall not apply to—
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.any person performing work, duties or services relating to the crossing or the approach roads;
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.any constable acting in the execution of his duty;
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.any member of the naval, military or air forces while on duty in the service of the Crown; or
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.any inspector appointed under section 19 of the [1974 c. 37.] Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974 acting in the execution of his duty;

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.or to any vehicle of which any such person is in charge or to any person to whom it would otherwise apply only in consequence of a breakdown of a vehicle or other emergency.

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.A person who contravenes the restriction imposed by subsection (1) above shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 3 on the standard scale.
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.Any such person may be stopped by any traffic officer or by any person employed at the crossing for the purpose of the collection of tolls.

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.Any person who is about to contravene the restriction imposed by subsection (1) above may be prevented from doing so by any traffic officer or by any person so employed.

Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.For the purposes of this section a person contravenes the restriction imposed by subsection (1) above if he uses any part of the crossing or of the approach roads contrary to the restriction or if he is in charge of an animal or vehicle which does so; and where he does so by being in charge of an animal or vehicle a traffic officer or person so employed may move the animal or vehicle to a place where the restriction does not apply.
Restriction on use by certain classes of traffic.A traffic officer or person so employed may exercise the powers conferred by subsections (6) to (8) above with such assistance as he thinks necessary.

Special traffic restrictions.In relation to roads within the crossing and the approach roads the power conferred by subsection (3) of section 14 of the [1984 c. 27.] Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 (temporary restriction or prohibition of traffic on roads) shall be exercisable—
Special traffic restrictions.by a constable or traffic officer (as well as by the Secretary of State as the highway authority) on a ground on which it is exercisable by that authority; and

Special traffic restrictions.by the Secretary of State or a traffic officer where a restriction or prohibition appears necessary or expedient for the purpose of maintaining or improving any part of the crossing.

Special traffic restrictions.Where that power is exercised by a constable or traffic officer it may be exercised either by notice or by an appropriate means of communication; and subsections (4) and (7) of that section shall apply in relation to an appropriate means of communication as they apply in relation to a notice under subsection (3) of that section.

Special traffic restrictions.Where that power is exercised in relation to any road within the crossing a traffic officer may, either by notice or by an appropriate means of communication, make as respects any other road within the crossing—
Special traffic restrictions.any such provision as is described in section 2(2)(a) to (c) of the [1984 c. 27.] Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 (direction of traffic, waiting, etc.); or
Special traffic restrictions.any provision restricting the speed of vehicles;

Special traffic restrictions.and any restriction or prohibition imposed under this subsection shall be treated for the purposes of section 16(1) of that Act (offence of contravention) as if imposed under section 14 of that Act.

Special traffic restrictions.A notice or an appropriate means of communication under subsection (3) above may suspend any statutory provision of a description which could have been contained in it and any such provision shall have effect subject to it.

Special traffic restrictions.In this section "an appropriate means of communication" means any reasonable means for communicating the restriction or prohibition to persons affected by it, other than a notice.
Large vehicles and safety.Regulations may make provision—
Large vehicles and safety.for the regulation by the crossing operator of the use of the crossing by vehicles exceeding such dimensions or weight as may be prescribed;

Large vehicles and safety.for the prohibition or regulation by the crossing operator of the conveyance through the tunnels of any goods, substances or other things capable of being conveyed which are dangerous, including provision for searching vehicles suspected of conveying any such things; and
Large vehicles and safety.for eliminating or reducing the risk of fire in the tunnels.

Large vehicles and safety.The regulations may include provision requiring the prescribed person to pay to the crossing operator in respect of the use of the crossing by vehicles such as are mentioned in subsection (1)(a) above a charge of an amount determined in accordance with such scales and other provisions as may be prescribed.

Large vehicles and safety.Any person who contravenes or fails to comply with any regulations made under subsection (1)(b) above shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.

Large vehicles and safety.In proceedings brought against any person for an offence under subsection (3) above it shall be a defence for him to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.
Removal of stationary vehicles.For the purpose of preventing obstruction of the crossing and the approach roads, regulations may—
Removal of stationary vehicles.prohibit vehicles from stopping or remaining at rest in prescribed parts of the crossing or of the approach roads except in prescribed circumstances; and

Removal of stationary vehicles.make such provision as is mentioned in subsection (3) below with respect to vehicles which, either in contravention of the regulations or in such circumstances to which subsection (2) below applies as may be prescribed, are for the time being at rest in any prescribed part of the crossing or of the approach roads.
Removal of stationary vehicles.The circumstances to which this subsection applies, in relation to any vehicle, are any circumstances in which—
Removal of stationary vehicles.it is necessary for the vehicle to remain at rest by reason of breakdown; or
Removal of stationary vehicles.no person is for the time being in charge of the vehicle or the person in charge of it is not present in or on the vehicle.
Removal of stationary vehicles.The regulations may—

Removal of stationary vehicles. require the person (if any) in charge of any vehicle which is at rest by reason of breakdown in any prescribed part of the crossing or of the approach roads to take prescribed steps for reporting that fact and the position and circumstances in which the vehicle is at rest;
Removal of stationary vehicles.prohibit any person, other than a constable or traffic officer—

Removal of stationary vehicles.from carrying out, or attempting to carry out, any repair, adjustment or refuelling of any such vehicle except with permission expressly given by a constable or traffic officer;
Removal of stationary vehicles.from moving, or attempting to move, any such vehicle from the position in which it is at rest;

Removal of stationary vehicles.include provision for empowering a constable or traffic officer to remove any vehicle which is at rest in any prescribed part of the crossing or of the approach roads from its position to a place within the crossing or the approach roads where the regulations do not prohibit vehicles stopping or remaining at rest; and

Removal of stationary vehicles.include provision, in the case of any vehicle which is so removed by a traffic officer or which at the request of the person in charge of it is repaired, adjusted or refuelled (instead of being removed) by a traffic officer, for requiring the prescribed person to pay to the crossing operator a charge of an amount determined in accordance with such scales and other provisions as may be prescribed.

leaf.margin: Services for transporting cycles and cyclists through crossing.

content.leaf: Services for transporting cycles and cyclists through crossing.The Secretary of State shall either provide, maintain and operate vehicles for the purpose of carrying pedal cycles and cyclists through the crossing or make such arrangements as he considers appropriate with any other person for securing the provision, maintenance and operation of vehicles for that purpose.

Services for transporting cycles and cyclists through crossing.No charge shall be made in respect of the carriage of any cycle or cyclist on any vehicle provided by, or in pursuance of arrangements made by, the Secretary of State under subsection (1) above.
Traffic officers.The crossing operator shall appoint persons to act as traffic officers.

Traffic officers.It shall be the duty of every traffic officer to secure the observance and enforcement of the provisions of this Part of this Act and of regulations made under it, in particular by exercising functions conferred on traffic officers by any such provision.
Traffic officers.It shall also be the duty of every traffic officer to secure the observance and enforcement of—

Traffic officers.any traffic regulation order made under section 1 of the [1984 c. 27.] Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and any prohibition or restriction imposed under section 14 of that Act or section 24 of this Act as respects any road within the crossing or the approach roads; and
Traffic officers.any byelaws made or treated as made under the 1984 Act as they have effect by virtue of this Act.

Traffic officers.Every traffic officer may stop and direct traffic within the crossing and, so far as is necessary for the performance of any of his duties under subsections (2) and (3) above, on the approach roads.
Traffic officers.A traffic officer shall not act as such unless in uniform.

Traffic officers.Every officer who immediately before the transfer date was acting as a traffic officer under section 36 of the 1984 Act shall be treated as if he was appointed to act as a traffic officer under this section on that date.
Offences.Any person who—
Offences.without reasonable excuse refuses or fails to pay any charge which he is liable to pay under regulations made under section 25 or 26 of this Act;
Offences.resists or intentionally obstructs a traffic officer in uniform acting in the execution of his duty; or
Offences.contravenes or fails to comply with any regulations made under this Part of this Act, other than regulations made under section 25(1)(b) of this Act;
Offences.shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 3 on the standard scale.
Miscellaneous and supplementary

Planning permission.If any works for or in connection with the exercise of any functions under this Part of this Act or the maintenance or improvement of any part of the crossing are carried out on any land otherwise than by or on behalf of the Secretary of State, they shall not be taken for the purposes of the [1971 c. 78.] Town and Country Planning Act 1971 to involve development of the land.

Pollution controls, etc.If any operation for or in connection with the maintenance or improvement of any part of the crossing is carried out otherwise than by or on behalf of the Secretary of State, a prohibition or restriction to which this section applies shall not have effect in relation to the operation if it would not have effect in relation to the operation if the operation were carried out by the Secretary of State.
Pollution controls, etc.This section applies to—
Pollution controls, etc.any prohibition on the carrying out of operations or on carrying them out without the consent of any person;
Pollution controls, etc.any restriction on the level of noise which may be emitted in the course of carrying out operations;
Pollution controls, etc.any prohibition or restriction on the times when or the period of time for which operations may be carried out; and
Pollution controls, etc.any prohibition or restriction on depositing materials in or discharging materials into any waters;

Pollution controls, etc.imposed by or under any enactment other than this Act, other than any prohibition or restriction imposed by or under the relevant statutory provisions (within the meaning of Part I of the [1974 c. 37.] Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974).
Pollution controls, etc.In this section "operation" means any works or action.

Recovery of tolls and charges.Where any tolls or any charges payable under regulations made under section 25 or 26 of this Act remain unpaid after they have become due for payment the crossing operator may recover from the person liable to pay them the amount of the tolls or charges together with a reasonable sum to cover administrative expenses.

leaf.margin: Accounts of person appointed under section 11.

content.leaf: Accounts of person appointed under section 11.Copies of any accounts of the person appointed to levy tolls under section 11 of this Act which are provided to the Secretary of State in pursuance of—
Accounts of person appointed under section 11.the contract under which that person was appointed; or
Accounts of person appointed under section 11.any contract relating to the levy of tolls by that person during any toll extension period under paragraph 4 of Schedule 6 to this Act;
Accounts of person appointed under section 11.shall be laid before Parliament by the Secretary of State.

Accounts of person appointed under section 11.In subsection (1) above "accounts" includes any documents which in the case of a company are treated by virtue of section 239 of the [1985 c. 6.] Companies Act 1985 as comprised in the company's accounts for the purposes of Part VII of that Act.

Accounts of Secretary of State.Where section 11(6) of this Act applies, the Secretary of State shall prepare a statement of accounts under this section in respect of each financial year falling wholly or partly within the period allowed under section 16 of this Act for the levy of tolls by him.

Accounts of Secretary of State.Any statement of accounts prepared under this section shall be in such form and contain such particulars, compiled in such manner, as the Treasury may from time to time direct.

Accounts of Secretary of State.Any such statement shall be sent by the Secretary of State to the Comptroller and Auditor General not later than the end of the month of November following the end of the financial year to which the statement relates.

Accounts of Secretary of State.The Comptroller and Auditor General shall examine and certify any statement sent to him under this section and shall lay copies of it, together with his report on it, before Parliament.

Offences by bodies corporate.Where a body corporate is guilty of an offence under this Part of this Act and the offence is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate or a person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, he as well as the body corporate shall be guilty of that offence and liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

Offences by bodies corporate.Where the affairs of a body corporate are managed by its members, subsection (1) above shall apply in relation to the acts and defaults of a member in connection with his functions of management as if he were a director of the body corporate.

leaf.margin: Application of Part III to Crown.

content.leaf: Application of Part III to Crown.Subject to the preceding provisions of this Part of this Act and to subsection (2) below, this Part of this Act and any regulations made under it shall have effect in relation to persons in the public service of the Crown, vehicles belonging to, or used for the purposes of, a Minister of the Crown or Government department and things done, or omitted to be done, in connection with such vehicles by such persons as they have effect in relation to other persons or vehicles.
Application of Part III to Crown.Regulations made under section 25 or 26 of this Act may provide that, in their application in relation to—
Application of Part III to Crown.vehicles belonging to the Crown and used for naval, military or air force purposes; and

Application of Part III to Crown.vehicles used for the purposes of any such body, contingent or detachment of the forces of any country as is a visiting force for the purposes of any of the provisions of the [1952 c. 67.] Visiting Forces Act 1952, or used for the purposes of any headquarters or organisation designated by an Order in Council under section 1 of the [1964 c. 5.] International Headquarters and Defence Organisations Act 1964;
Application of Part III to Crown.the regulations shall have effect subject to such modifications as may be prescribed.
Miscellaneous and General
Works affecting the river Thames.The Secretary of State may, for the purpose of or in connection with the construction, maintenance or improvement of any part of the crossing—

Works affecting the river Thames.temporarily alter or interfere with the river and construct, place and maintain within the relevant limits in the river all such temporary piles, fenders, booms, dolphins, pontoons, caissons, cofferdams, embankments, aprons, abutments, stagings, piers, wharves, walls, fences, drains, stairs, buildings or other works as he may deem necessary or expedient;
Works affecting the river Thames.moor or anchor temporarily, or cause to be moored or anchored temporarily, in the river barges or other vessels or craft; and
Works affecting the river Thames.temporarily close the river or any part of it to navigation.
Works affecting the river Thames.In subsection (1)(a) above "relevant limits" means—
Works affecting the river Thames.in relation to the bridge, the limits of land to be acquired;

Works affecting the river Thames.in relation to the tunnels, the limits of deviation specified in each of the Acts repealed by the [1967 c. xxxvii.] Dartford Tunnel Act 1967 and in that Act by which works were authorised by reference to the plans and sections deposited in connection with the Bills for those Acts.

Works affecting the river Thames.Before exercising any of the powers conferred by subsection (1) above, the Secretary of State shall consult the Port Authority; but section 70 of the [1968 c. xxxii.] Port of London Act 1968 (licence from Port Authority required for works in river) and section 73 of that Act (licence from Port Authority required for dredging there) shall not apply in relation to anything done in the exercise of any of those powers within the limits of land to be acquired.

Works affecting the river Thames.In exercising the power conferred by subsection (1)(c) above the Secretary of State shall ensure that no more of the river is closed to navigation at any time than is at that time necessary in the circumstances.

Works affecting the river Thames.If complete closure of the river to navigation becomes necessary the Secretary of State shall use his best endeavours to secure that the minimum obstruction, delay or interference is caused to vessels which may be using or intending to use the river.

Works affecting the river Thames.Neither the Secretary of State nor the Port Authority shall be liable for any loss suffered or any costs or expenses incurred by any person as a direct or indirect result of any closure of the river in accordance with this section.

leaf.margin: Restrictions on works on crossing and approach roads.

content.leaf: Restrictions on works on crossing and approach roads.No works shall be carried out in, on, under or over any part of the crossing or of the approach roads otherwise than by or on behalf of the Secretary of State unless the Secretary of State gives his written consent.

Restrictions on works on crossing and approach roads.Consent under subsection (1) above may be granted subject to such reasonable terms and conditions (including conditions imposing a charge) as the Secretary of State may determine; and any question whether any such terms and conditions are reasonable shall be determined by arbitration.
Restrictions on works on crossing and approach roads.Section 15 of the [1962 c. 58.] Pipe-lines Act 1962 shall not apply where this section applies.

Restrictions on works on crossing and approach roads.Subsection (1) above shall not be taken to require the consent of the Secretary of State for the carrying out of works in relation to any highway or railway passing under or over any part of the crossing or of the approach roads.

Application of public utilities street works code to all works at the crossing.In so far as, apart from this section, Part II of the [1950 c. 39.] Public Utilities Street Works Act 1950 (public utilities street works code where undertakers' apparatus is affected by road works) would not apply in relation to works for the construction, maintenance or improvement of any part of the crossing, that Part of that Act shall apply as if such works were mentioned in section 21(1)(a) of that Act and as if any undertakers' apparatus affected by any such works were in a street.
Rating.No part of the crossing shall be liable to be rated or to be included in any valuation list or in any rate.

Protection of interests.Schedule 7 to this Act shall have effect for protecting the interests of the bodies and persons specified in that Schedule (being bodies and persons who may be affected by other provisions of this Act).

Particulars of the bridge

The piers in the river Thames carrying the central span of the bridge shall be so placed that, on the centre line of the bridge as constructed, there shall be a distance of not less than 440 metres between the riverward faces of the piers, and any permanent fenders for the protection of any such pier shall not extend more than 20 metres riverward from the face of the pier.

Each of those piers shall be so constructed as to allow for dredging of the river between the permanent fenders for the protection of the piers to a depth of 15.7 metres below ordnance datum (Newlyn).

The span of the bridge between those piers shall be so constructed that, for a distance of 100 metres, there is a headway under the deck of the span of not less than 57.5 metres above ordnance datum (Newlyn).
The height of the towers above those piers shall not exceed 148 metres above ordnance datum (Newlyn).
